turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: I better do some packin'.  I'm gonna be a hot number again after tomorrow.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Then why you doin' it?

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Seems worthwhile, doesn't it? Maybe it's just for the cave-in on Lonnegan's face when we put in the sting.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Henry.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Yeh.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I appreciate your stickin' your neck out.  I wouldn't have asked ya if it weren't for Luther.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Ain't nothin' gonna make up for Luther, kid.  Revenge is for suckers.  I been griftin' 30 years and never got any.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: You beat him, kid.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: You were right, Henry.  It's not enough... But it's close.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: You wanta wait for your share?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Naw, I'd just blow it.

turns.speaker: NILES
turns.text: He's been taking the 8:10 Century Limited outa New York on Friday and getting in here early Saturday morning.  He usually stays a day to check on his policy operations, and then flies back.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Wonder why he doesn't fly both ways.

turns.speaker: NILES
turns.text: The porters say he runs a braced card game in one of the cars.  $100 minimum, straight poker.  Last time he pulled in here ten grand heavier than he left New York.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Fancies himself a gambler, huh?

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: We'll use the wire.  Never known a gambler who wouldn't like to beat the ponies.

turns.speaker: NILES
turns.text: The wire is ten years outa date.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: That's why he won't know it.

turns.speaker: NILES
turns.text: All you gotta do is show up with some money and look like a fool.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: I also gotta win.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: He's gonna hit ya with 20 grand, Eddie.  How much cash we got?

turns.speaker: NILES
turns.text: Not enough to cover a bet that big.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Get a couple extra guys in the line, then.  We'll give him the shut-out.

turns.speaker: NILES
turns.text: Looks like he's sulking.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: If we're lucky, this'll bring him back stronger than ever.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: What's the problem?

turns.speaker: NILES
turns.text: He wants to put a half million on Syphon.

turns.speaker: SINGLETON
turns.text: Lonnegan's a fast egg, Henry.  He's not gonna sit still for a standard play.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Everybody'll sit still for somethin'. What did ya find out about the train, Eddie?

turns.speaker: SINGLETON
turns.text: I'm not sure I know it.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: We'll give him the hook on the train, and play him here.  You think I can get in that poker game, Eddie?

turns.speaker: SINGLETON
turns.text: You in?

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Yeh, I think so.  I gave the kay- ducer a C-note.  You find out the deck?

turns.speaker: SINGLETON
turns.text: He usually plays with a Royal or a Cadenza.  I got you one of each.  He likes to cold deck low, 8's or 9's.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Nice work, J.J.

turns.speaker: SINGLETON
turns.text: Look at that.  He's got four apes with him.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: That's what I like about these guys, J.J... They always got protection against things we'd never do to 'em.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: How ya doin'?

turns.speaker: SINGLETON
turns.text: Nothin' yet.  I got a good one on the lead at Hialeah, but he's fadin'.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Yeh, that'd be real nice of ya, Mr. Lonneman.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: Lonnegan.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: Raise 500.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: See ya and raise three.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: See and raise five.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Five and call.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Raise 300.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: Pass.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Raise 1,000.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: Raise 500.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: See and raise 1,000.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Raise 5,000.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: I guess I left it in my room.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: What!  Don't give me that crap you little weenie.  How do I know you ain't gonna take a powder.  You come to a game like this, you bring your money.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Never get enough, huh pal?  I'd think you'd get tired of losin', Honnigan.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: The name is Lonnegan.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: Make sure you see cash from this guy, Eddie.  He's got the name for bettin' money he don't have.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: I can't lay that off in time.  We lose a bet that big, it could break us.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: If ya win it could make ya, too.

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: What are the odds on Syphon?

turns.speaker: GONDORFF
turns.text: A half mill on an eight to one shot. You're dumber than I thought, Lonnegan.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: You're more gutless than I thought.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: She coulda killed me last night.

turns.speaker: GUNMAN
turns.text: Too many people coulda seen ya go in her room.  She was a professional. Used to work in the Dutch Schultz gang.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: GUNMAN
turns.text: Gondorff asked me to look after ya.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: How do I know you're tellin' the truth.

turns.speaker: GUNMAN
turns.text: Don't have much choice, do ya?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Hi there, Snyder.  Things a little slow down at the Bunco Department tonight, eh?  Somebody lose the dominoes?

turns.speaker: SNYDER
turns.text: You scored blood money today, Hooker.  You need a friend.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Aw, find yourself a shoplifter to roll.

turns.speaker: SNYDER
turns.text: I'll tell ya what you did, smart boy.  You tied into a loaded mark on 47th across from Maxies.  You and Coleman played the switch for him and blew him off to a cab on 49th.  If he hadn't been a numbers runner for Doyle Lonnegan, it woulda been perfect.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: You're crazy.  I'm not stupid enough to play for rackets money.

turns.speaker: SNYDER
turns.text: Not intentionally maybe, but that don't make no difference to Lonnegan. He'll swat you like any fly.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I'll square it with the fixer.

turns.speaker: SNYDER
turns.text: Nobody can buy you a prayer, if I put the finger on ya.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: My end was only one.

turns.speaker: SNYDER
turns.text: Then you'll have to come up with another grand somewhere.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Excuse me, sir.  Treasury Dept... I'd like to ask you a few questions.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: What for?  I haven't done anything.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: We don't doubt that, but there's a counterfeiting operation passing bad money in the station.  Have you made any purchases here today?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Yes, a ticket to Chicago.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Then I'm afraid we'll have to impound your money until we're sure that it's all good.  Can I see your wallet and your ticket, please?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: But I got a train to make.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: It'll only take 20 minutes or so. You can pick it up at the window down the hall.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: But what about all these other people?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: We'll get 'em!  Give us a chance. I'm not the only agent in here, ya know.  We go around advertising ourselves, how many counterfeiters do you think we'd catch, huh?  You think I'm wearin' this rag here 'cause I like it?  Christ, everybody thinks life's a holiday or somethin' when you got a badge.  I been here since three this morning, Charlie, and I never knew there was so much ugliness in people.  You try to help 'em and they spit on you.  I shoulda let ya go and gotten yourself arrested for passin' false notes.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I'm sorry, really I am, but my train leaves in ten minutes.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: All right, I'll give ya a break.  Down that hall there, there's an unmarked door on the left.  Go on in there and wait at the window. I'll take this...  ...in the back and run it through right away.  We'll have you outta there in a couple minutes.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Thank you.  You don't know how much I appreciate this.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Think nothin' of it.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: You done?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Yeh, I guess I shoulda had the meat loaf.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: It isn't any better.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Where's June today?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: She don't work here no more.  I'm fillin' in for a couple days... till I can get a train outa here.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Where you goin'?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I don't know.  Depends what train I get on.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Meat loaf, apple pie and a cup of coffee.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Sixty-five.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: What time you get off work here?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: You doin' anything tonight?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Yeh, sleepin'.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: You got a back door to this place?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: No.  What's wrong with the front?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Look, I don't have time to fuck around.  There's somebody out there I don't need to see.  You got a fire escape or anything?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: All right, do me a favor.  Go into the bathroom, open the window and wait for me there.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: What the hell for?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Just do what I tell ya and everything'll be jake.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: What does this guy want?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: He'd like to kill me.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Looks like he missed ya.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Yeh, this time anyway.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I, ah...thought you might wanna come out for a while.  Maybe have a drink or somethin'.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: You move right along, don't ya.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I don't mean nothin' by it.  I just don't know many regular girls, that's all.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: And you expect me to come over, just like that.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: If I expected somethin', I wouldn't be still standin' out here in the hall.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I don't even know you.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: You know me.  I'm just like you... It's two in the morning and I don't know nobody.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: You sure it'll be one of these two?

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: No.  They're just the only ones we know of.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Twist?  I told him the tale.  He wants to see ya.

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: All right, when?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Tomorrow, after 4:00.  Stay inside, I'll come in and get ya.  And be hard on him for a while; he's talking money.

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: Okay, Tootsie.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Les, I got Mr. Lonnegan with me. He wants to see you a second.

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: What the hell's the matter with you. We coulda met at a club or somethin'.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I thought it might be good for him to see the setup.

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: Well we can't talk in here.  They're having the place painted.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Hooker!

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: How ya doin', Jimmy.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Ain't seen you in months, boy. Thought maybe you took a fall.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Naw, just a little hard times, that's all.  It's all over now.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You gonna have a go here?  How 'bout a ten spot on the line here.  The 4-9 been lookin' good today.  Lotsa action on 28th Street down there, too.  Pay ya 10-1.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You sure you wanna start off that big?  Bet like that could put a real dent in us.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I feel lucky tonight.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Aw, come on, Hooker, why don't you just...

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Three grand on the black, Jimmy.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: Your boss is quite a card player, Carver.  How does he do it?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: He cheats.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: He'll have to take a check.  I couldn't find my wallet.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Yeh, he knows that.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: He hired a dame to take it from ya.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: You were set up, Lonnegan.  Shaw's been planning to beat your game for months.  He was just waiting for you to cheat him so he could clip ya.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: I could have you put under this train for this, errand boy.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: So could Shaw.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: Then why the rat?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Cause I'm tired of bein' his nigger.  I want you to help me break him.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: What's the matter?  You gotta get back to Shaw?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Naw, he picked up some jane in the bar.  Can't see him till morning anyway.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: All right, then.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: Why me?  Shaw probably has lotsa enemies to choose from.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I need somebody respectable...but not completely legit.  What I'm gonna do isn't very legal.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: I'm a banker, friend.  That's legit in this state.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: All you gotta do is place a bet for me at Shaw's place.  I'll supply all the money and the information.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: If you help me out, I'll pay ya back the money you owe Shaw, myself.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: That's worth fifteen grand to ya?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Maybe a couple million.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: You're dreamin', kid.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: 660 Marshall Street.  Tomorrow at 12:30, if you're interested.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: If I'm not there by quarter of, I'm not coming.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: You should always look to the back too, kid.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I was afraid you weren't gonna come. We haven't got much time.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: Get on with it then.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Sometime after 1:00 a guy's gonna call here and give you the name of a horse.  All you do is take this two grand across the street to Shaw's place and bet it on that pony.  There's nothin' to it, but don't take too much time.  We only have 3 or 4 minutes after you get the call.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: You're not gonna break him with a $2,000 bet.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: This is just a test.  The big one comes later.  Be careful with that though, it's all I got.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: And you were gonna pay me back?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I am after this race.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: You really picked a winner, kid.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Give 'em a little time.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Well, what did I tell ya?

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: You're a lucky man, all right.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Lucky, hell.  I could do it every day.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: Why don't ya then.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: 'Cause it's better to do it all at once.  We're puttin' down 400 grand next week.  At 5-1 we make 2 million. Twenty per cent of that is yours if ya stick with us.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: You got a system, Carver?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: You stayin' in or not?

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: I'm in.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: It's foolproof.  We got a partner downtown runs the central office of the Western Union.  Race results from all over the country come in there and go right across his desk on their way to the bookies.  All he does in hold them up a couple minutes until he can call us and get a bet down on the winner.  Then he releases the results to the bookies and we clean up on a race that's already been run.  It can't miss, unless the Western Union Dicks get onto it.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: You got the 400 grand yet?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Not yet, but...  Hey, there's only a grand here.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: I think we oughta place another bet tomorrow.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: What is this?  That's my money. You tryin' to muscle me?

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: If your system's as foolproof as you say, you'll get even more.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I gotta talk to me partner first. We can't afford to expose our game too much.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: Let me talk to him.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: You want your money back?  Try and get it in a court of law.  C'mon, don't be a sorehead.  I'll make it worth your while.  Migth even help ya finance the big play if this one works out.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: What happened to your face?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Had a little fight with a raggle down on 13th.  She got me with her ring.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: A week's a long time, friend. Anything can happen.  All of it bad.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: He's right, Les.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: I didn't get the bet down in time.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Oh, Jesus.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: Tell your friend I'll have the money here by post-time tomorrow. We'll take the first race where the odds are 4-1 or better.  And make sure I can get to that window this time.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: How am I gonna do that?

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: I don't know, figure something out.

turns.speaker: POLK
turns.text: You want a drink or something?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: POLK
turns.text: We want to talk to ya about Henry Gondorff.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Don't think I know him.

turns.speaker: POLK
turns.text: Well give yourself a couple seconds, crumb.  You wouldn't wanna lie to me.  Lt. Snyder here says you done a lotta griftin' in this town.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Lt. Snyder doesn't know shit.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: You got nothin' on me.

turns.speaker: POLK
turns.text: We'll get it, and if we can't, we'll just make it up.  Grand larceny, extortion.  Counterfeiting, anything you want.

turns.speaker: POLK
turns.text: Look, I got nothin' against you, but you're in trouble here.  All you gotta do is tell us when Gondorff's gonna play his chump. We come in at the sting, make the pinch, and you walk out free as a bird.  No questions, no court appearance, nothing.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: POLK
turns.text: You've already done time twice, and judges don't like three time losers. You wanna sit in the can for forty years, startin' tonight?

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I'll make parole.

turns.speaker: POLK
turns.text: Like hell.  You won't even get a review till you're seventy.  And if the board starts to go soft, we'll let ya out in the yard some night with a hard-nose young bull who'll put fifty slugs in your face and ask what you were doin' there later.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Will you wait until the chump is played?

turns.speaker: POLK
turns.text: Hell yes.  We don't care about the mark.  He deserves what he gets.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: I mean completely played.  Until he's beat and the score is taken. You come in before we beat him and I'll kill him.  You'll have a tough time explaining that, won't ya.

turns.speaker: POLK
turns.text: All right, Hooker, but you take it on the lam, and we'll shoot you down on sight.

turns.speaker: HOOKER
turns.text: Just as long as I get to finish the play.

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: Can't do it.  There're telegraph inspectors all over the place.  I got 750 grand coming in from the coast, and I'm not gonna blow it for a lousy 14 gees.  We'll get somebody else to do our betting.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: I could come up with 750 grand in a day if I had a reason to.

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: But who says you will.  I got a guy I can depend on.  He's liquidating everything he has for this.  You wouldn't even give Carver his money back.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: I need more proof, that's all. Anybody can get lucky once.

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: On a 6-1 shot?  The hell with ya. We'll keep the deal we got.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: If it works again tomorrow, I'll have a half million in cash here by noon the next day.  We split 60-40.

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: We were getting 50 from our guy.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: With 20% coming off the top for me laying your bet.  Either way you end up with 40.

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: Yeh, and what if we play tomorrow and he doesn't come up with the money.  We risk our whole operation for nothing.  I'll say when we make our bets.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: Not if you want me to keep makin' 'em for ya.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: Take it easy.  Everything's all right.  I put it on Syphon, on the nose.

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: On the nose!  I said place.  Place it on Syphon.  That horse is going to run second.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: All right, Riley.  What the hell happened?

turns.speaker: RILEY
turns.text: We missed him.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: You weren't hired to miss him.

turns.speaker: RILEY
turns.text: There wasn't any way he coulda known we was in there.  We made a clean pick on the lock and didn't leave no footprints in the hall. Somebody musta wised him up.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: Yeh, and what does Cole say about that?

turns.speaker: RILEY
turns.text: I don't know.  He took it hard.

turns.speaker: LONNEGAN
turns.text: All right, get outa here.  You're outta work.

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: We'll take it.  You manage the building at the end of the alley?

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: For fifteen years.

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: I'll need a room over there that faces this way.  How much a week?

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: Only rents by the month.  Two hundred and fifty for the two of them.

turns.speaker: TWIST
turns.text: This is the last time I expect to see you down here.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: Never heard of the place.

turns.speaker: SNYDER
turns.text: What is this?  I got work to do.

turns.speaker: POLK
turns.text: Sit down and shut up, will ya.  Try not to live up to all my expectations.  We were told you know a hustle artist named Johnny Hooker.

turns.speaker: POLK
turns.text: Do ya know him or don't ya?

turns.speaker: SNYDER
turns.text: Yeh, but I don't know where he is.

turns.speaker: POLK
turns.text: Well we do.  He's chummin' around with a Big C named Henry Gondorff. Ring any bells?

turns.speaker: SNYDER
turns.text: Sure.  Every bunco man in the country knows Gondorff.

turns.speaker: POLK
turns.text: There's word he's gonna run a con on the North Side here.  We got a year-old Florida warrant on him, but it's a thin beef, and he can beat it in court unless we catch him cold.  All we want you to do is pick up Hooker for us.

turns.speaker: SNYDER
turns.text: Why don't you pick him up yourself?

turns.speaker: POLK
turns.text: Cause the stoolies are used to street dicks jumpin' him.  If word gets around that Feds are in on it too, Gondorff'll fold up the whole thing.

turns.speaker: SNYDER
turns.text: Wouldn't that be too bad.  You'd hafta move outa this nice office ya got.

turns.speaker: POLK
turns.text: Don't crack wise to me, flatfoot. I spent a lotta time in dumps like this, eatin' Gondorff's dust while the bunco squad gets rich tippin' him off.  But it's not gonna happen this time.  We're not even gonna let the police know we're here.  If you keep your mouth shut and do a job, there'll be a promotion in it for ya.  And you better take it, cause I can make ya work for us without it.

turns.speaker: SNYDER
turns.text: What the hell good is Hooker to ya?

turns.speaker: POLK
turns.text: He's gonna set up Gondorff for us.

turns.speaker: SNYDER
turns.text: He'll never do it.

turns.speaker: POLK
turns.text: I think he will.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Sorry.  I don't know anything about it.

turns.speaker: 1ST REPORTER
turns.text: Come on, gimme a break.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I never tried to kid you reporters -- I'm telling you the truth.

turns.speaker: 1ST REPORTER
turns.text: Have the police got any idea where Wynant is?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: 1ST REPORTER
turns.text: What about this Rosebreen?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Sorry.  Don't know a thing.

turns.speaker: 1ST REPORTER
turns.text: What's your next step, Nick?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Right back to California.  We've got to go home and rest up from our vacation.

turns.speaker: 1ST REPORTER
turns.text: We'll see you before you go.

turns.speaker: GILBERT
turns.text: There's a physiological as well as a psychological angle in my father's relationship with Julia Wolf that the police have overlooked.  And I think it explains everything.  You see, my father was a sexogenarian.

turns.speaker: 1ST REPORTER
turns.text: He was?

turns.speaker: GILBERT
turns.text: Yes.  He admitted it.

turns.speaker: 1ST REPORTER
turns.text: Sexogerarian, eh?  Yes.  Yes.  But I can't put that in the paper.

turns.speaker: GILBERT
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: 1ST REPORTER
turns.text: You know how they are... sex...

turns.speaker: GILBERT
turns.text: Then just say he was sixty years old.

turns.speaker: 1ST REPORTER
turns.text: Is that what it means?

turns.speaker: GILBERT
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: I didn't know you invented that Smelting Process.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Look -- those are the first metals that came through.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: All settled?  Grand!  Why did your mother ever divorce him?  He's swell.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Wel-l-l, it seems he has a secretary.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Oh.  I'll do my own typing!

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Cheer up, darling.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: What's the matter, darling ... not sweet enough?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: It's all right.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Darling, your father's all right. He'll turn up in time.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: But tonight is Christmas Eve!

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: He's just forgotten.  You know he forgets everything.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: He's never forgotten a promise to me.  I'm worried about him.  I know something's happened to him.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: What could happen to him, darling? You mustn't worry....  What is it?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Just a minute...

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Now don't say that -- he's just off somewhere working.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I can't find him.  I've tried everything.  I thought you might know.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Any luck?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: He's just around the corner.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: She's got me worrying, too.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Don't start worrying about him. He's a good guy, but screwy.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Why did that man want to kill him?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Said he stole his invention.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Do you suppose.....  ?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You better take a drink.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: How are you?

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Another young man.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: It's the same one.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Well!

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: That is, if it's all right with you.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: And if it isn't?

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Mind if I look around?

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Help yourself.  Oh, Tom, show this gentleman...

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, Andy.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Don't cry.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I can't help it.  You don't know.....

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Darling, you can't go through any more of this.  Now you get together your clothes and your skates and we'll go out to my family's in the country.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I can't.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: You've got to get your mind off this.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: You're sweet, but the only thing that you can do for me is to go.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Go!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: And don't ever try to see me again.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Please!  You can't get mixed up in this.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Do you think I care

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: You don't understand.  You don't know what's going to happen.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I only know I want to marry you... right now, and --

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I can't marry you!  I can't ever marry you!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Dorothy!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: How would you like to have a couple of little murderers for your children?  It'd be fun, wouldn't it?  Maybe they'd murder each other...  keep it all in the family. That's what Father should have done.  He should have killed me and Gilbert... then we wouldn't have had this to go through.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: You're talking like a crazy person,

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Why not? I am crazy....the whole family's crazy.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Dorothy.... listen to me. I love you.  Don't you understand that? I love you.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Go away!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: This is a pretty dead bunch, isn't it?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: You're high enough.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Darling, don't cry.  Please.  I know it's terrible.  But isn't it really better this way?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh, Andy, Andy!

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: How are you?....  Oh, I'm Mrs. Jorgensen now....  No, she isn't here.  Is it about her father?  Well, can I take the message?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Give it to me.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Oh, here she is.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: What is it? Has he found him?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Do you know where he's living?  Oh....  Well, at least I'm glad he's all right.  Thank you for calling. Goodbye.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: That isn't true.  It was about your father.  Where is he?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: He's all right.  Isn't that enough?

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: You just want money -- and you haven't any right to any more.  He made a big settlement on you.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: That's gone long ago.  I've got to see him.  Where is he?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I won't have you hounding him any more for money.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Mother ....  you couldn't do that. You couldn't go to her.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: I didn't say I would.  But we've got to have money.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Did it ever occur to you that Chris might work?

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Shush!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Don't.  It's horrible.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Nonsense! She got at she deserved.
